member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.Project_Battle(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,System.Int32)
member.summary: project_battle figures out the number of turns it takes for first_pokemon to destroy the second_pokemon using attacking_move. Passing a non-damaging move does not work.
member.param: It is recommended to pass a clone.
It is recommended to pass a clone.
An integer to indicate if the user wants to project the battle using max(1), min(-1), or regular(0) damage.
member.returns: The number of turns until second_pokemon faints

member.summary: Checks if Pokemon and its URI is in the Dictionary
member.returns: A boolean saying yes or no if the pokemon exists in the dictionary
member.remarks: Kind of a useless function because if Pokemon is not in dictionary, it means that the master database doesn't have such pokemon. So it could mean that the user typed a non-existant pokemon, spelling error, or a brand new pokemon

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Dictionary.Add_Pokemon(System.String,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon)
member.summary: Inserts Pokemon into the pokemon_dictionary. No need to format poke_name. The function will handle it.
member.remarks: The function does not query the database. The querying is left to the user. No need to format poke_name as the function will clean it up.

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Dictionary.Add_Pokemon(System.String)
member.summary: Queries the master database using URL. No need to format poke_name. The function will format it properly for you.
member.remarks: This function will probably be used more than its other overloaded counterpart. This function handles all the URL stuff and parsing.

member.summary: Adds a move to the dictionary

member.remarks: No need to specially format the arguments.

member.name: P:PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info.Effect

member.summary: Returns the effectiveness of the pokemon as an unsigned long.
member.param: No need to format it. Function will format it accordingly.
No need to format it. Function will format it accordingly.
member.returns: An unsigned long. 0 is no effect, 0.5 is not very effective, 1 is normal, 2 is super effective, 100 is couldn't locate

member.param: List of Strings of the types of the pokemon
